reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Integrated Emergency Nutrition and WASH Interventions in Ambassel Woreda, South Wollo Zone, Amhara Region

description.narrative:
The overall objective of this project is to provide lifesaving emergency nutrition and WASH services, thereby contributing to reduction of morbidities and mortalities associated with malnutrition amongst under-five children and pregnant and lactating women (PLW) in drought affected Woreda, Ambassel, South Wollo Zone, ANRS.
The project focuses on providing tailored and effective, technical and logistics support to the Woreda Health Office to address to their need to effectively treat and manage severe and moderate acute malnutrition (SAM and MAM) in children under five years and pregnant and lactating women and minimize suffering associated with malnutrition. WVE will support the Woreda Health Office (WrHO) to deliver high quality full CMAM services including treating severely malnourished children with medical complication in SC, treating and feeding malnourished children without complication at OTP, rehabilitating at risk and moderately malnourished children to prevent deterioration in to SAM through Targeted Supplementary Feeding Program (TSFP), and community mobilization.
In order to attain the project objective, it employs core strategies including capacity building, community mobilization and participation strengthening the existing health programs and integration of CMAM in to various Area Programs (APs) currently run by WVE. The project will directly benefit 1,879 children with SAM amp MAM and 829 malnourished PLW in the Woreda. This project prioritizes those most vulnerable groups of people – children with high degree of vulnerability like children with disability as primary beneficiaries, particularly malnourished under-five children and pregnant and lactating women in all steps of the project implementation. In addition, the project is designed to integrate gender throughout the interventions. Staff with health or nutrition backgrounds who have proven experience on emergency nutrition programs on similar settings will be hired.

receiver-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs
